messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last 200 years, technology and health became better. This meant fewer children died when they were young. This caused fast population growth. These large families had even more children who grew up and had their own families. However, things changed in the 1960s. Contraception means methods to prevent having a baby. It became easier to get contraception. Because of this, the average number of babies per woman went down. The number dropped from six to as low as two.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. The text adheres perfectly to all B1 rules. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is controlled. The keyword 'contraception' is defined simply and correctly. The text is factually accurate.
